DOC.brief_summary: The study investigate effect avocado consumption marker vascular health . Sixty participant enrol 6-week study . A randomized parallel design utilized . Participants either receive typical American diet , modify typical American diet avocado substitute food contain moderate high amount saturate fat , allow isoenergetic inclusion avocado .
DOC.brief_title: The Effect Avocado Consumption Vascular Health
DOC.criteria: BMI 25 42 kg/m2 Age 28 70 year intervention Fasting glucose ≤ 126 mg/dl Blood pressure ≤ 160/100 mm Hg Presence kidney disease , liver disease , gout , certain cancer , thyroid disease , gastrointestinal , metabolic disease , malabsorption syndrome Women give birth previous 12 month Pregnant woman woman plan become pregnant become pregnant study Lactating woman Type 2 diabetes require use oral antidiabetic agent insulin History eat disorder dietary pattern consistent dietary intervention ( e.g. , vegetarian , low fat diet , high protein diet ) Volunteers routinely participate `` heavy '' exercise volunteer initiate exercise program study . Volunteers lose 10 % body weight within last 12 month Use prescription overthecounter antiobesity medication supplement ( e.g. , phenylpropanalamine , ephedrine , caffeine , least 6 month prior start study ) history surgical intervention obesity Active cardiovascular disease ( heart attack procedure within past three month participation cardiac rehabilitation program within last three month , stroke history/treatment transient ischemic attack past three month , document history pulmonary embolus past six month ) Smokers tobacco user ( 6 month prior start study ) Unable unwilling give inform consent communicate study staff Selfreport alcohol substance abuse within past twelve month and/or current acute treatment rehabilitation program problem ( Longterm participation Alcoholics Anonymous exclusion . ) Other medical , psychiatric , behavioral factor judgment Principal Investigator may interfere study participation ability follow intervention protocol .
